availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Edwin Quisenberry (Nicholas County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Nicholas County, Kentucky, attorney. Virginia native. Married to Anna Francis Price Quisenberry. Father of Lucy Quisenberry, John A. Quisenberry, and Robert Taylor Quisenberry. Attorney in Nicholas County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Nicholas County in 1850. Attorney in Nicholas County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Nicholas County in 1860. Attorney in Kentucky in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 2, pp. 392B and 393A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 2, p. 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, Carlisle, p. 277.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 1 (Town of Carlisle), p. 137A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, Precinct 4, p. 234A.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 05, Division 8, District 2, Kentucky, 1863, (Accessed via ancestry.com on March 19, 2020).
Find a Grave, “Thomas Edwin Quisenberry (1820-1871),” Memorial 41856130, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/41856130/thomas-quisenberry (Accessed February 11, 2017).
